intro: Chrysophyllum schomburgkianum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces edible, star-shaped fruits that are typically consumed fresh or used in culinary applications. Its bark and leaves have also been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their potential health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
